update.description:
This is a work in progress PR. In it, I address [CLOUD-138](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-138) and partially [CLOUD-139](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-139), as the `simulator_ready` is yet to be merged.

Also, a new line in the status sub box should contain `harness_status`.

Related: [#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/67/monitor-src-ihmc-controller-and-harness/diff](#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/67/monitor-src-ihmc-controller-and-harness/diff)

I believe there is an issue in the SENDING LOGS state of the state machine:

From logging the change of the srcsimData value, I noticed that the state goes from Ready to Running when a round is clicked. After stopping, it is finishing, finished and then it goes back to ready, skipping the Sending Logs state. Could it be that, since the tests are quick, the logs is fast enough to not being caught by the console log?

fyi @andres_fortier , @iche033 , @preyna 

Screenshot

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496789072025.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1259108785-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496789072025.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496789072025.png')
update.title: Status display in Kiosk

content.raw: I have to go now, but if you think the messages of the tooltips are correct, feel free to merge @chapulina !
content.html: I have to go now, but if you think the messages of the tooltips are correct, feel free to merge @chapulina !

content.raw:
Thank you for the comments and review @preyna . I addressed them.

I see that the `harness_status` and `simulator_ready` fields are being sent so it is safe to merge.

What do you think about the tooltips, @chapulina ?
content.html:
Thank you for the comments and review @preyna . I addressed them.

I see that the harness_status and simulator_ready fields are being sent so it is safe to merge.

What do you think about the tooltips, @chapulina ?

I believe there is an issue in the SENDING LOGS state of the state machine:

From logging the change of the srcsimData value, I noticed that the state goes from Ready to Running when a round is clicked. After stopping, it is finishing, finished and then it goes back to ready, skipping the Sending Logs state. content.raw: I think you can remove these TODO lines
content.html: I think you can remove these TODO lines

content.raw: I think you can remove these TODO lines
content.html: I think you can remove these TODO lines

content.raw:
I addressed your comments. Renamed some status messages and included @iche033 's suggestions for tooltips.

I don't have a better naming proposition for "Process", I believe we shouldn't name this "State" as it might not be descriptive or significant to the users.

The tooltips given are:

* Process: Status of the docker container
* Simulator: Status of the launch process
* Harness: Status of the harness in simulation

Suggestions for better names/descriptions are welcome.

ptal @preyna
content.html:
I addressed your comments. Renamed some status messages and included @iche033 's suggestions for tooltips.

I don't have a better naming proposition for "Process", I believe we shouldn't name this "State" as it might not be descriptive or significant to the users.

The tooltips given are:

  • Process: Status of the docker container
  • Simulator: Status of the launch process
  • Harness: Status of the harness in simulation

Suggestions for better names/descriptions are welcome.

ptal @preyna

From logging the change of the srcsimData value, I noticed that the state goes from Ready to Running when a round is clicked. content.raw:
I think `Simulator` is the status of the launch process. => Specifically if the walking and grasping controller topics are working or not

`Process` is probably the status of the docker container?
content.html:
I think Simulator is the status of the launch process. => Specifically if the walking and grasping controller topics are working or not

Process is probably the status of the docker container?

content.raw: +1 to the tooltips
content.html: +1 to the tooltips

content.raw:
For me the Simulator should be "Simulation" (if I understood correctly, what we launch when we do run_gazebo.bash is a Simulation, right ? ) 

The "Process" is the "state machine" running in the cloudsim-sim . It launches bash scripts . I'm not sure what name to use here :( . Maybe  "Server " ?

Harness: I'm not sure what it this  :'(
content.html:
For me the Simulator should be "Simulation" (if I understood correctly, what we launch when we do run_gazebo.bash is a Simulation, right ? )

Harness: I'm not sure what it this :'(

content.raw:
I included the `harness_status` in the Status box, as an integer. Please note that the [Monitor SRC ihmc controller and harness status PR](#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/67/monitor-src-ihmc-controller-and-harness/diff) should be merged first, as this PR depends on it.

This is available for review now.

ptal @andres_fortier , @preyna

Screenshot - Note that I commented the Practice Mode box so it would look like the finals. The missing status parameters were hardcoded in it.

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496840571919.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/148758665-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496840571919.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496840571919.png')
content.html:
I included the harness_status in the Status box, as an integer. Please note that the Monitor SRC ihmc controller and harness status PR should be merged first, as this PR depends on it.

This is available for review now.

content.raw:
Regarding the missing sending_logs state , I think it is because it is being overwritten at cloudsim-sim level before it is even sent back to portal. 
This happens when subsequent events are so fast that override (using underscore's extend) cloudsim-sim current/last event before it is sent . From the UI point of view, this should not affect your work.
content.html: Regarding the missing sending_logs state , I think it is because it is being overwritten at cloudsim-sim level before it is even sent back to portal. This happens when subsequent events are so fast that override (using underscore's extend) cloudsim-sim current/last event before it is sent . From the UI point of view, this should not affect your work.

content.raw: ok ya it should be `simulator_ready`
content.html: ok ya it should be simulator_ready
